content.title: CIFE - Institutional Fellowship
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.beneficiary: Students pursuing Masters and Ph.D. in Fisheries Science
content.details: ICAR-CIFE offers two years Masters (Masters in Fisheries Science) and three years Doctoral (Ph.D.) degrees in as many as eleven specialised disciplines of fisheries sciences. CIFE offers its own degrees since its recognition as Deemed to be University in 1989.
benefits: Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) for post-graduate education leading to a Master's Degree Program at the rate of Rs. 5760/- per month for two years.
Contingent grant of Rs. 6000/- per annum for procurement of essential chemicals, equipment, books and travel allowances.
Senior Research Fellowship (SRF) for Ph.D. Degree at the rate of Rs. 7000/- per month for the first two years and Rs. 5600/- in the third year.
Institutional Fellowship for M.F.Sc. Programs at the rate of Rs. 5040/- per month for two years.
Contingent grant of Rs. 10,000/- per year at Ph.D. level.
eligibility: For M.F.Sc: Bachelor's Degree in the concerned field under 10 + 2 + 4 with at least 60% marks or OGPA of 6.50 out of 10.00.
For Ph.D: B.F.Sc. & M.F.Sc. or B.Sc & M.Sc. with specific OGPA requirements.
Foreign students are exempted from appearing in the written test and interview.
content.application_process: Application Forms can only be submitted online mode on the website https://icar.nta.ac.in.

faqs.question: Is there direct admission to ICAR AUs through nomination, without qualifying in AIEEA-UG/AIEEA- PG/AICE-JRF-SRF(PhD)?
faqs.answer: There is no provision of direct nomination for admission through ICAR in any programme without qualifying in AIEEA-UG/AIEEA-PG/AICE-JRF-SRF(PhD).

faqs.question: What are different modes to apply for AIEEA-UG/AIEEA-PG/AICE- JRF-SRF(PhD)?
faqs.answer: Application Forms can only be submitted through online mode on the website https://icar.nta.ac.in.

faqs.question: Can I submit more than one application form for the exam?
faqs.answer: NO. Only ONE application is to be submitted by a candidate for appearing in the exam.
